meanings.definition: A person who hesitates or refuses to proceed with an action.
meanings.sent1: The baulkers at the party were too shy to join the dance.
meanings.sent2: The teacher encouraged the baulkers to participate in the group project.
meanings.sent3: The baulkers at the restaurant couldn't decide what to order.
meanings.sent4: The baulkers in the race were left behind by the confident runners.
meanings.sent5: The baulkers in the meeting made the decision-making process slower.

meanings.definition: Plural form of baulker, referring to multiple individuals who hesitate or refuse to proceed with an action.
meanings.sent1: The baulkers gathered outside the haunted house, unsure if they should enter.
meanings.sent2: The baulkers in the group discussion preferred to listen rather than speak up.
meanings.sent3: The baulkers at the amusement park couldn't agree on which ride to go on first.
meanings.sent4: The baulkers in the negotiation room delayed reaching a compromise.
meanings.sent5: The baulkers in the team project slowed down the progress of the entire group.
